def1: the basic monetary unit of the UK, equal to 100 pence.
def2: The Licked Hand, known sometimes as The Doggy Lick or Humans Can Lick Too, is an urban legend. It has several versions, and has been found in print as early as February 1982.

def1: a thick, soft, moist substance typically produced by mixing dry ingredients with a liquid.
def2: waste material produced in the making of prehistoric stone implements.

def1: a code word representing the letter H, used in radio communication.
def2: Yulimar Rojas Rodríguez is a Venezuelan athlete who holds the world record for women's triple jump, currently 15.74 m. She is the current Olympic champion, a three-time World Champion, and three-time World Indoor Champion ; she is nicknamed la reina del triple salto – queen of the triple jump. Since 2014 she has held, and continued to beat, Venezuelan national records in triple jump and long jump. She is a recipient of the Venezuelan Order of José Félix Ribas – First Class.

def1: a flat surface of a gem.
def2: each of a group of numbers used to indicate the position of a point, line, or plane.

def1: use a mouse to move a cursor on a computer screen.
def2: Dhruv Vikram is an Indian actor, singer and lyricist who works in Tamil films. The son of actor Vikram, he made his acting debut with the 2019 romantic drama Adithya Varma and has since starred with his father in Mahaan (2022).

def1: perform (two notes) as one unbroken note.
def2: the science or practice of using or constructing communications systems for the transmission or reproduction of information.

def1: (1812–86), US inventor and industrialist. In 1846, he developed a successful rotary press, which greatly increased the speed of printing.
def2: (1880–1918), French poet; pseudonym of Wilhelm Apollinaris de Kostrowitzki. He coined the term surrealist and was acknowledged by the surrealist poets as their precursor. Notable works: Les Alcools (1913) and Calligrammes (1918).

def1: form into or cover with sharp points.
def2: the action of relieving a bankrupt from residual liability.

def1: a country in southeastern Europe; population 11,000,000 (estimated 2015); official language, Greek; capital, Athens. The age of the classical city states, of which the most prominent were Athens and Sparta, reached its peak in the 5th century BC, after which Greece fell to Macedonia and then became part of the Roman and Byzantine Empires. It was conquered by the Ottoman Turks in 1466 and remained under Turkish rule until the war of independence from 1821 until 1830, after which it became a kingdom. The monarchy was overthrown in a military coup in 1967, and a civilian republic was established in 1974. Greece joined the EC (now the EU) in 1981.
def2: (469–399 BC), ancient Athenian philosopher. As represented in the writings of his disciple Plato, he engaged in dialogue with others in an attempt to reach understanding and ethical concepts by exposing and dispelling error (the Socratic method). Charged with introducing strange gods and corrupting the young, he committed suicide as required.

def1: a newspaper.
def2: an evergreen dwarf shrub related to the bearberry, native to California.

def1: an object, shape, or arrangement in the form of a pyramid.
def2: having a sexual relationship with only one partner at a time.

def1: movies considered as an art or industry.
def2: cause (someone) to become hostile or angry.

def1: a person whose business is preparing dead bodies for burial or cremation and making arrangements for funerals.
def2: a dead body, especially of a human being rather than an animal.

def1: the natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible.
def2: the partial or total absence of light.

def1: a spiritual being believed to act as an attendant, agent, or messenger of God, conventionally represented in human form with wings and a long robe.
def2: (in a bird) a modified forelimb that bears large feathers and is used for flying.

def1: leave someone's company.
def2: sad and disappointed.

def1: a mythical animal typically represented as a horse with a single straight horn projecting from its forehead.
def2: fictitious.

def1: the corresponding digit of primates or other mammals.
def2: enable (someone or something) to escape from an unpleasant situation.

def1: a waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait.
def2: a domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.

def1: unfamiliar and disturbing or distasteful.
def2: Eric Aaron Bischoff is an American television producer, professional wrestling booker, and performer. He is best known for serving as Executive Producer and later Senior Vice President of World Championship Wrestling (WCW) and subsequently, the on-screen General Manager of WWE's Raw brand. Bischoff has also worked with Total Nonstop Action Wrestling (TNA) where he served as Executive Producer of Impact Wrestling. He was inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame in 2021.

def1: capture on film as part of a series of moving images; make a movie of (a story or event).
def2: a two-masted sailing ship with a square-rigged foremast and a fore-and-aft-rigged mainmast.

def1: used in names of newspapers and journals.
def2: a resort island in the Gulf of Gabès off the coast of Tunisia.

def1: a gambling game in which a ball is dropped onto a revolving wheel (roulette wheel) with numbered compartments, the players betting on the number at which the ball will come to rest.
def2: the possibility that something unpleasant or unwelcome will happen.

def1: the main events of a play, novel, movie, or similar work, devised and presented by the writer as an interrelated sequence.
def2: a story or event recorded by a camera as a set of moving images and shown in a theater or on television; a motion picture.

def1: a laboratory.
def2: the systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world through observation, experimentation, and the testing of theories against the evidence obtained.

def1: an imaginary or mythical being of human form but superhuman size.
def2: of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.

def1: used figuratively as a symbol or type of firmness, strength, or resistance.
def2: the main research library of Oxford University, and one of six copyright libraries in the UK.

def1: a very tall building of many stories.
def2: restore to life or consciousness.

def1: vegetation consisting of typically short plants with long, narrow leaves, growing wild or cultivated on lawns and pasture, and as a fodder crop.
def2: a long, narrow leaf of grass or another similar plant.

def1: any hard, pointed defensive projection or structure, such as a prickle of a hedgehog, a spike-like projection on a sea urchin, a sharp ray in a fish's fin, or a spike on the stem of a plant.
def2: cause (something) to change orientation.

def1: a person trained to care for the sick or infirm, especially in a hospital.
def2: affected by physical or mental illness.

def1: a person who steals another person's property, especially by stealth and without using force or violence.
def2: take (another person's property) without permission or legal right and without intending to return it.

def1: the quality of transparency and brilliance shown by a diamond or other gem.
def2: (of a plant) without buds, eyes, or terminal flowers.

def1: (of a police force) have the duty of maintaining law and order in or for (an area or event).
def2: An organization or organisation, is an entity—such as a company, an institution, or an association—comprising one or more people and having a particular purpose.

def1: the dimensions of height, depth, and width within which all things exist and move.
def2: a mode of linear extension of which there are three in space and two on a flat surface, which corresponds to one of a set of coordinates specifying the position of a point.

def1: a computer or computer program which manages access to a centralized resource or service in a network.
def2: a number of interconnected computers, machines, or operations.

def1: a waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait.
def2: a domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, nonretractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.

def1: the cultivated feathery-leaved plant of the parsley family that yields this vegetable.
def2: a small person (often used as a term of endearment).

def1: a man devoted to the service of a woman or a cause.
def2: a war between Communist North Vietnam and US-backed South Vietnam. After the partition of Vietnam in 1954, the communist North attempted to unite the country as a communist state, fueling US concern over the possible spread of communism in Southeast Asia. US Army forces were sent to Vietnam in 1964, supported by contingents from South Korea, Australia, New Zealand, and Thailand, while US aircraft bombed North Vietnamese forces and areas of Cambodia. The Tet Offensive of 1968 damaged US confidence, and US forces began to be withdrawn, finally leaving in 1973. The North Vietnamese captured the southern capital Saigon to end the war in 1975.

def1: fit (a person or animal) with a tube to assist breathing, especially after a laryngotomy.
def2: occur at the start of; open.

def1: move or cause to move into a position of contact with something by exerting continuous physical force.
def2: bring one's hand or another part of one's body into contact with.

def1: something regarded as bringing about or portending good or bad things.
def2: a grass with a loose, branching cluster of flowers, sometimes grown for fodder or ornamental purposes.

def1: an industrial city in the northwestern part of the state of New York; population 270,919 (est. 2008). Located at the eastern end of Lake Erie, it is a major port on the St. Lawrence Seaway.
def2: think deeply or focus one's mind for a period of time, in silence or with the aid of chanting, for religious or spiritual purposes or as a method of relaxation.

def1: the male of some horned animals, especially the fallow deer, roe deer, reindeer, and antelopes.
def2: a large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs and a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads.

def1: a building used for public Christian worship.
def2: relating to or professing Christianity or its teachings.

def1: (of a person) allow oneself to fall; let oneself down without jumping.
def2: breath, considered as a life-giving force.

def1: a large, luxurious automobile, especially one driven by a chauffeur who is separated from the passengers by a partition.
def2: a tree fern found in forests throughout New Zealand.

def1: mark with a date.
def2: Lizards are a widespread group of squamate reptiles, with over 7,000 species, ranging across all continents except Antarctica, as well as most oceanic island chains. The group is paraphyletic since it excludes the snakes and Amphisbaenia although some lizards are more closely related to these two excluded groups than they are to other lizards. Lizards range in size from chameleons and geckos a few centimeters long to the 3-meter-long Komodo dragon.

def1: a ship or boat.
def2: Angela Gabrielle White is an Australian pornographic film actress and director who predominantly works in the United States. She has been inducted into the AVN Hall of Fame and the XRCO Hall of Fame, and in 2020 became AVN's first three-time Female Performer of the Year winner.

def1: a device that generates an intense beam of coherent monochromatic light (or other electromagnetic radiation) by stimulated emission of photons from excited atoms or molecules. Lasers are used in drilling and cutting, alignment and guidance, and in surgery; the optical properties are exploited in holography, reading bar codes, and in recording and playing compact discs.
def2: a ray or shaft of light.

def1: a town or city with a harbor where ships load or unload, especially one where customs officers are stationed.
def2: a very large expanse of sea, in particular each of the main areas into which the sea is divided geographically.

def1: each of the surfaces of a solid.
def2: the line along which two surfaces of a solid meet.

def1: a wooden shaft fitted to the front of a cart or carriage drawn by animals and attached to their yokes or collars.
def2: an opening in the deck of a boat or ship leading to the cabin or a lower level, especially a hold.

def1: a thin hollow tube of paper or plastic for sucking drink from a glass or bottle.
def2: a long, hollow cylinder of metal, plastic, glass, etc. for holding or transporting something, chiefly liquids or gases.

def1: a large piece of rock which has become detached from a cliff or mountain; a boulder.
def2: a set of bells in a tower, played using a keyboard or by an automatic mechanism similar to a piano roll.

def1: (of a plant or animal species) introduced from another country and later naturalized.
def2: (1818–1910), French ballet dancer and choreographer, resident in Russia from 1847; full name Marius Ivanovich Petipa. He choreographed more than 50 ballets, working with Tchaikovsky on Sleeping Beauty (1890) and The Nutcracker (1892).

def1: ride a bicycle.
def2: sit on and control (a bicycle or motorcycle) for recreation or as a means of transport.

def1: a shoe for a horse formed of a narrow band of iron in the form of an extended circular arc and secured to the hoof with nails.
def2: having the form of a curve; bent.

def1: Amazon.com, Inc. is an American multinational technology company that focuses on e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence. It has been referred to as "one of the most influential economic and cultural forces in the world", and is one of the world's most valuable brands. It is one of the Big Five American information technology companies, alongside Alphabet, Apple, Meta, and Microsoft.
def2: Jeffrey Preston Bezos is an American entrepreneur, media proprietor, investor, computer engineer, and commercial astronaut. He is the founder, executive chairman and former president and CEO of Amazon. With a net worth of around US$136 billion as of September 2022, Bezos is the second-wealthiest person in the world and was the wealthiest from 2017 to 2021 according to both Bloomberg's Billionaires Index and Forbes.

def1: a long, slender, rounded piece of wood or metal, typically used with one end placed in the ground as a support for something.
def2: a straight or curved continuous extent of length without breadth.

def1: a legendary island, beautiful and prosperous, which sank into the sea.
def2: Khartoum or Khartum is the capital of Sudan. With a population of 5,274,321, its metropolitan area is the largest in Sudan. It is located at the confluence of the White Nile, flowing north from Lake Victoria, and the Blue Nile, flowing west from Lake Tana in Ethiopia. The place where the two Niles meet is known as al-Mogran or al-Muqran. From there, the Nile continues north towards Egypt and the Mediterranean Sea.

def1: a tube of metal, plastic, or other material used to convey water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances.
def2: a solid geometric figure with straight parallel sides and a circular or oval cross section.

def1: an eight-legged predatory arachnid with an unsegmented body consisting of a fused head and thorax and a rounded abdomen. Spiders have fangs that inject venom into their prey, and most kinds spin webs in which to capture insects.
def2: a small insect.

def1: catch with a hook.
def2: ornamented with embedded pieces of a decorative material flush with the surface.

def1: a tribunal presided over by a judge, judges, or a magistrate in civil and criminal cases.
def2: a public official appointed to decide cases in a court of law.

def1: the personification of the power that destroys life, often represented in art and literature as a skeleton or an old man holding a scythe.
def2: the action of excising something.

def1: an ancient god, regarded as a god of agriculture.
def2: a shark of tropical and temperate oceans that has flattened blade-like extensions on either side of the head, with the eyes and nostrils placed at or near the ends.

def1: the amount, level, or extent to which something happens or is present.
def2: meet (someone) face to face with hostile or argumentative intent.

def1: insert (a piece of text or other data copied from elsewhere).
def2: reproduce (data stored in one location) in another location.

def1: make or become rigidly fixed or immovable.
def2: a small bag sewn into or on clothing so as to form part of it, used for carrying small articles.

def1: A leprechaun is a diminutive supernatural being in Irish folklore, classed by some as a type of solitary fairy. They are usually depicted as little bearded men, wearing a coat and hat, who partake in mischief. In later times, they have been depicted as shoe-makers who have a hidden pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.
def2: an island of the British Isles, lying west of Great Britain. Approximately four fifths of the area of Ireland forms the Republic of Ireland, with the remaining one fifth forming Northern Ireland. Ireland was inhabited by Celts from about the 6th century BC. English invasions began in the 12th century under Henry II, although the whole of the island was not conquered until the time of the Tudors. Revolts against English rule led to English and Scottish families being settled on confiscated land; in parts of Ulster the descendants of Protestant settlers form a majority. After an unsuccessful rebellion in 1798, union of Britain and Ireland followed in 1801. Increased prosperity was experienced in Protestant Ulster, but not in the rest of the island, and after the failure of the potato crop in the 1840s thousands died in a famine, and thousands more emigrated. After World War I Ireland was divided into two self-governing areas. For later history see Ireland, Republic of and Northern Ireland.

def1: a deep brown color.
def2: (in Australian Rules) an act of charging into an opponent's chest, typically so as to knock them to the ground.

def1: disguise an awkward problem instead of resolving it.
def2: the Turkic language of the Kyrgyz, with approximately 2 million speakers.

def1: a small room in which a prisoner is locked up or in which a monk or nun sleeps.
def2: a building in which people are legally held as a punishment for a crime they have committed or while awaiting trial.

def1: a representation of a human figure created with compressed snow.
def2: openly resist or refuse to obey.

def1: the period of darkness in each twenty-four hours; the time from sunset to sunrise.
def2: Thomas Edward Bosley was an American actor, television personality and entertainer. Bosley is best known for portraying Howard Cunningham on the 1970s ABC sitcom Happy Days, and the title character on the NBC/ABC series Father Dowling Mysteries. He also was featured in a recurring role on Murder, She Wrote. He originated the title role of the Broadway musical Fiorello!, earning the 1960 Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Musical.

def1: a person with expert local knowledge qualified to take charge of a ship entering or leaving confined waters; a helmsman.
def2: an incorporated municipality in certain US states.

def1: an industrial city in central New York, on the Mohawk River; population 33,673 (est. 2008).
def2: Nathaniel Arcand is a Canadian actor. He is known for his first major role in the Canadian drama series North of 60, in which for three seasons he played William MacNeil, smart-mouthed and cocky, a troubled, misunderstood teen. In 1997, he was nominated for a Gemini Award in the category "Best Performance by an Actor in a Featured Supporting Role in a Dramatic Series" for the North of 60 episode "Traces and Tracks."

def1: new or unusual in an interesting way.
def2: a football game played after the regular season between leading or all-star teams.

def1: a torch of pitch and tow for lighting the way in dark streets.
def2: (1906–97), US Supreme Court associate justice 1956–90. He was a New Jersey Supreme Court judge 1952–56 before being appointed to the US Supreme Court by President Eisenhower. He was noted for his defense of First Amendment rights.

def1: place or lay (something) on the ground or hit the ground with it.
def2: (of a vehicle) capable of traveling without input from a human operator, by means of computer systems working in conjunction with on-board sensors.

def1: a commercial organization offering subscribers special benefits.
def2: a colorless toxic liquid used as an organic solvent.

def1: the indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future regarded as a whole.
def2: a mechanical or electrical device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds, typically by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures.

def1: a thick protective outer part or page of a book or magazine.
def2: Shiv Pandit, known professionally as Shiv Panditt, is an Indian actor, model, emcee, radio jockey and television host. He is the brother of Gayatri Pandit, who has been an assistant director on the films Desi Boyz (2011), Boss (2013), Roy (2015), Shivaay (2016), Om The Battle Within (2021) and Arjun Pandit, an ex sports anchor on NDTV and STAR Sports. Shiv is also the co-owner of the Chandigarh Cubs cricket team in the Box Cricket League (B.C.L.) along with actress Anita Hassanandani.

def1: a machine with moving parts that converts power into motion.
def2: operate and control the direction and speed of a motor vehicle.

def1: voice or vocal ability, especially of a powerful singer.
def2: an act of using the hands clumsily while doing or handling something.

def1: an industrial city in southwestern Ontario, Canada, situated to the north of Lake Erie; population 353,395 (2006).
def2: showing or feeling no concern for others' feelings.

def1: move (a stitch) to the other needle without knitting it.
def2: Joshua Thomas McDaniels is an American football coach who is the head coach for the Las Vegas Raiders of the National Football League (NFL). He began his NFL career in 2001 with the New England Patriots, where he served as the offensive coordinator for 14 non-consecutive seasons. During McDaniels' first stint as offensive coordinator from 2006 to 2008, New England set the record for points scored, and in 2007, became the first team in NFL history to win all 16 regular season games. In his second stint from 2012 to 2021, the Patriots won three Super Bowl titles in Super Bowl XLIX, Super Bowl LI, and Super Bowl LIII. McDaniels was also among the Patriots personnel to be present for all six of their titles during the Brady–Belichick era.

def1: a thick, soft, moist substance typically produced by mixing dry ingredients with a liquid.
def2: (in soccer) a pass of the ball in a specified direction or manner.

def1: not strongly or heavily built or constructed.
def2: (1809–65), French social philosopher and journalist. His pamphlet What is Property? (1840) argues that property, in the sense of the exploitation of one person's labor by another, is theft.

def1: cause to seem small or insignificant in comparison.
def2: (of an acid) corrode a surface.

def1: the flat part of either side of the head between the forehead and the ear.
def2: the upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs.

def1: strike (an object) repeatedly so as to make a noise.
def2: Nyle DiMarco is an American model, actor, and deaf activist. In 2015, DiMarco was the winner of The CW's reality television series America's Next Top Model in season 22, becoming the second male winner and the first deaf winner. In the following year, he and professional dance partner Peta Murgatroyd were the winners of the ABC televised dance competition Dancing with the Stars in season 22.

def1: a small flat ring made of metal, rubber, or plastic fixed under a nut or the head of a bolt to spread the pressure when tightened or between two joining surfaces as a spacer or seal.
def2: an ancient civilization of northern Nigeria, dated to the 5th–3rd centuries BC. It is characterized by the production of distinctive terracotta figurines and is significant for its development of iron-working.

def1: a country in northeastern Africa, on the Mediterranean Sea; population 91,500,000 (estimated 2015); capital, Cairo; official language, Arabic. The population of Egypt is concentrated chiefly along the fertile valley of the Nile River because the rest of the country is largely desert. Egypt's history spans 5,000 years: the ancient kingdoms of Upper and Lower Egypt were ruled successively by 31 dynasties, which may be divided into the Old Kingdom, the Middle Kingdom, and the New Kingdom. Egypt was a center of Hellenistic culture and then a Roman province before coming under Islamic rule and then becoming part of the Ottoman Empire. Modern Egypt became independent in 1922. From 1958 to 1961 Egypt was united with Syria as the United Arab Republic, a title it retained until 1971. Wars with Israel were fought in 1967 (the Six Day War) and 1973 (the Yom Kippur or October War); the countries signed a peace treaty in 1979. In 2011 a series of popular demonstrations led to president Hosni Mubarak leaving office.
def2: a nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

def1: the extinct language of the Aztecs, a Uto-Aztecan language from which modern Nahuatl is descended.
def2: a climbing shrub with purplish flowers, deeply divided leaves, and purple berries. Native to eastern Asia, it is grown as an ornamental in North America.

def1: a stupid or gullible person.
def2: decompress (a file) that has previously been compressed.

def1: a panning movement.
def2: Triton is a Greek god of the sea, the son of Poseidon and Amphitrite, god and goddess of the sea respectively. Triton lived with his parents in a golden palace on the bottom of the sea. Later he is often depicted as having a conch shell he would blow like a trumpet.

def1: a state of armed conflict between different nations or states or different groups within a nation or state.
def2: a container filled with explosive, incendiary material, smoke, gas, or other destructive substance, designed to explode on impact or when detonated by a time mechanism, remote-control device, or lit fuse.

def1: a terrestrial arachnid with pincers similar to those of a lobster and a venomous sting at the end of its jointed tail, which it can hold curved over its back. Most kinds live in tropical and subtropical areas.
def2: a small sharp-pointed organ at the end of the abdomen of bees, wasps, ants, and scorpions, capable of inflicting a painful or dangerous wound by injecting poison.

def1: a bed and associated facilities making up a place for a patient in a hospital or for a guest at a hotel.
def2: the latest information about something.

def1: the inner surface of the hand between the wrist and fingers.
def2: the end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb.

def1: the system in the EU for establishing common prices for most agricultural products within the European Union, a single fund for price supports, and levies on imports.
def2: Riverdale is an American supernatural horror crime drama television series based on the characters of Archie Comics. The series was adapted for The CW by Archie Comics' chief creative officer Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa, and is produced by Warner Bros. Television and CBS Studios, in association with Berlanti Productions and Archie Comics. Conceived as a feature film adaptation for Warner Bros. Pictures, the idea was re-imagined as a television series for Fox. In 2015, development on the project moved to The CW, where the series was ordered for a pilot. Filming takes place in Vancouver, British Columbia.

def1: a major city and port in southeastern New York, situated on the Atlantic coast at the mouth of the Hudson River; population 8,363,710 (est. 2008). It is situated mainly on islands, linked by bridges, and consists of five boroughs: Manhattan, Brooklyn, the Bronx, Queens, and Staten Island. Manhattan is the economic and cultural heart of the city, containing the stock exchange on Wall Street and the headquarters of the United Nations.
def2: Shriya Saran Bhatnagar (pronounced [ʃrɪja səɾən]; is an Indian actress and model who works predominantly in Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi-language films. Although Saran aspired to become a well-known dancer, she became an actress with her film debut in 2001 with the Telugu film Ishtam, and had her first commercial success with Santhosham. She is one of the most popular and highest-paid actresses in south cinema industry, and has acted in over 75 films.

def1: a quick lowering of the head.
def2: be repulsive or distasteful to.

def1: satellite television.
def2: the wine cup used in the Christian Eucharist.

def1: a large, heavy, cumbersome man.
def2: a long or roundabout route that is taken to avoid something or to visit somewhere along the way.

def1: the female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
def2: a country in southwestern Europe, occupying the greater part of the Iberian peninsula; population 46,100,000 (estimated 2015); official language, Spanish (also Catalan, Galician, Basque); capital, Madrid. Spain was dominated by the Moors between 711 and 718 until the rise of independent Christian kingdoms, notably Aragon and Castile, in the medieval period; the last Moorish stronghold, Granada, was won back in the late 15th century. Under the Habsburg kings of the 16th century, Spain became the dominant European power, building up a huge empire in America and elsewhere; most of this was lost in the early 19th century. The Spanish Civil War (1936–39) was followed by the establishment of a Fascist dictatorship under General Franco; after his death in 1975 a constitutional monarchy was re-established. Spain became a member of the EC (now the EU) in 1986.

def1: Ketchup or catsup is a table condiment with a sweet and tangy flavor. The unmodified term ("ketchup") now typically refers to tomato ketchup, although early American recipes used egg whites, mushrooms, oysters, grapes, mussels, or walnuts, among other ingredients.
def2: buy or accept goods in the knowledge that they have been stolen.

def1: write code for (a computer program).
def2: (1848–1907), US sculptor; born in Ireland. He is best remembered for his coin designs and for his sculptures, such as “General Sherman on Horseback” (1903) at the corner of New York City's Central Park.

def1: a mathematical concept generally regarded as a set of points having some specified structure.
def2: having complex patterns of colors; multicolored.

def1: investigate (someone) thoroughly, especially in order to ensure that they are suitable for a job requiring secrecy, loyalty, or trustworthiness.
def2: Lindsay Dee Lohan is an American actress and singer. Born in New York City and raised on Long Island, Lohan was signed to Ford Models at the age of three. Having appeared as a regular on the television soap opera Another World at age 10, her breakthrough came in the Walt Disney Pictures film The Parent Trap (1998). The film's success led to appearances in the television films Life-Size (2000) and Get a Clue (2002), and the big-screen productions Freaky Friday (2003) and Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen (2004).

def1: a written order to a bank to pay a stated sum from the drawer's account.
def2: (of a check) be returned by a bank when there are insufficient funds to meet it.

def1: an error in a computer program or system.
def2: A steak is a thick cut of meat generally sliced across the muscle fibers, sometimes including a bone. It is normally grilled or fried. Steak can be diced, cooked in sauce, such as in steak and kidney pie, or minced and formed into patties, such as hamburgers.

def1: the tree which bears apples.
def2: The Father is a 2020 psychological drama film directed by Florian Zeller, in his directorial debut; he co-wrote the screenplay with fellow playwright Christopher Hampton based on Zeller's 2012 play Le Père, which is part of a trilogy that also includes Le Fils and The Mother. A French-British co-production, the film stars Anthony Hopkins, Olivia Colman, Mark Gatiss, Imogen Poots, Rufus Sewell, and Olivia Williams, and follows an octogenarian Welsh man living with dementia. It is the second adaptation of the play after the 2015 film Floride.

def1: the invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
def2: a substance or matter in a state in which it will expand freely to fill the whole of a container, having no fixed shape (unlike a solid) and no fixed volume (unlike a liquid).

def1: An apple is an edible fruit produced by an apple tree. Apple trees are cultivated worldwide and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sieversii, is still found today. Apples have been grown for thousands of years in Asia and Europe and were brought to North America by European colonists. Apples have religious and mythological significance in many cultures, including Norse, Greek, and European Christian tradition.
def2: William Jacob Busey Jr. is an American actor. Among his most prominent roles have been serial killer Johnny Bartlett in 1996's The Frighteners, Ace Levy in 1997's Starship Troopers, Kyle Brenner in 2001's Tomcats, Aiden Tanner in the 2014–2016 TV series From Dusk till Dawn: The Series, and Sean H. Keyes in the Predator franchise.

def1: a pair of horns as an emblem of a cuckold.
def2: the Afro-Asiatic language of the Berbers. There are several different dialects; some of them, e.g., Tamashek, are regarded by some scholars as separate languages.

def1: a long-bodied chiefly marine fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, a prominent dorsal fin, and toothlike scales. Most sharks are predatory, although the largest kinds feed on plankton, and some can grow to a large size.
def2: (of a person or animal) use the teeth to cut into or through something.

def1: a shape which is defined by one or more lines in two dimensions (such as a circle or a triangle), or one or more surfaces in three dimensions (such as a sphere or a cuboid), either considered mathematically in geometry or used as a decorative design.
def2: (1817–86), English painter. After killing his father while suffering a mental breakdown, he was confined in asylums, where he produced a series of visionary paintings.

def1: a strong rhythm in popular music.
def2: vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.

def1: a side of a building or room, typically forming part of the building's structure.
def2: the structure forming the upper covering of a building or vehicle.

def1: a long-bodied chiefly marine fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, a prominent dorsal fin, and toothlike scales. Most sharks are predatory, although the largest kinds feed on plankton, and some can grow to a large size.
def2: a flattened appendage on various parts of the body of many aquatic vertebrates and some invertebrates, including fish and cetaceans, used for propelling, steering, and balancing.

def1: used or done on ceremonial occasions; involving the ceremony associated with a head of state.
def2: an authoritative warning or order.

def1: emerge or cause to emerge from a state of sleep; stop sleeping.
def2: a condition of body and mind that typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the eyes are closed, the postural muscles relaxed, the activity of the brain altered, and consciousness of the surroundings practically suspended.

def1: a straight strip or cylinder of plastic, wood, metal, or other rigid material, typically marked at regular intervals, to draw straight lines or measure distances.
def2: ascertain the size, amount, or degree of (something) by using an instrument or device marked in standard units or by comparing it with an object of known size.

def1: an ancient Roman or Greek measure of length, about 185 meters.
def2: Aubrey Morgan O'Day is an American singer and reality television personality, best known for being a member of the girl group Danity Kane. Following discord among Danity Kane and with her mentor at the time, P. Diddy, O'Day was fired from the group in 2008, but reunited with them in 2013 before a second disbandment. Danity Kane reunited in 2018 as a trio. She has also performed in the duo Dumblonde with former Danity Kane bandmate Shannon Bex since 2015.

def1: free passes of admission to a theater or other entertainment.
def2: Divergent is a 2014 American dystopian science fiction action film directed by Neil Burger, based on the 2011 novel of the same name by Veronica Roth. The film is the first installment in The Divergent Series and was produced by Lucy Fisher, Pouya Shahbazian, and Douglas Wick, with a screenplay by Evan Daugherty and Vanessa Taylor. It stars Shailene Woodley, Theo James, Ashley Judd, Jai Courtney, Ray Stevenson, Zoë Kravitz, Miles Teller, Tony Goldwyn, Ansel Elgort, and Maggie Q. The story takes place in a dystopian and post-apocalyptic Chicago where people are divided into distinct factions based on human virtues. Beatrice Prior is warned that she is Divergent and thus will never fit into any one of the factions. She soon learns that a sinister plot is brewing in the seemingly perfect society.

def1: a European country that forms the largest and most southern part of Great Britain and of the United Kingdom, surrounded on three sides by water (Irish Sea on west, English Channel on south, North Sea on east); population 51,446,000 (est. 2008); capital, London; language, English. England was conquered by the Romans in the first century AD, when it was inhabited by Celtic peoples. It was a Roman province until the early 5th century. During the 3rd–7th centuries Germanic-speaking tribes, traditionally known as Angles, Saxons, and Jutes, established a number of independent kingdoms there. England emerged as a distinct political entity in the 9th century before being conquered by William, Duke of Normandy, in 1066.
def2: publicly declare to be wrong or evil.

def1: a small timepiece worn typically on a strap on one's wrist.
def2: the part or joint connecting the hand with the forearm.

def1: the status or rank of full-grade captain in the Royal Navy.
def2: relating to or denoting polychaetes.

def1: be fed at the breast.
def2:
Algee Smith IV is an American actor and singer. After appearing in several small television roles, Smith first rose to fame portraying Ralph Tresvant in BET's The New Edition Story miniseries. The same year, he garnered critical acclaim as Larry Reed in Kathryn Bigelow's film Detroit. He is also known for his role as football player Christopher "Chris" McKay in 
the HBO drama series Euphoria.

def1: the Christian Eucharist or Holy Communion, especially in the Roman Catholic Church.
def2: a building used for public Christian worship.

def1: a row of plants sown in a furrow made by a drill.
def2: a quadruplet.

def1: hoist or draw (something) with a windlass, winch, or similar device.
def2: relating to or characteristic of the Malayalis.

def1: a piece of ground adjoining a building or house.
def2: a closed chamber with sealed-in gloves for handling radioactive or other hazardous material.

def1: an implement with two or more prongs used for lifting food to the mouth or holding it when cutting.
def2: an implement consisting of a small, shallow oval or round bowl on a long handle, used for eating, stirring, and serving food.

def1: a person who teaches, especially in a school.
def2: the process of receiving or giving systematic instruction, especially at a school or university.

def1: a fruit consisting of a hard or tough shell around an edible kernel.
def2: the oval edible nutlike seed (kernel) of the almond tree, growing in a woody shell, widely used as food.

def1: squeeze or crush (fruit, vegetables, etc.) to extract the juice or oil.
def2: relating to the Turkish dynasty of Osman I (Othman I), or to the branch of the Turks to which he belonged.

def1: a form of words used as a magical charm or incantation.
def2: the power of apparently influencing the course of events by using mysterious or supernatural forces.

def1: press, move, or touch (something) with one's thumb.
def2: approach (an age, figure, or level) very closely.

def1: impartial and just, without favoritism or discrimination.
def2: just behavior or treatment.

def1: the official residence or offices of an ambassador.
def2: the doctrine that consciousness and will are wholly due to material agency.

def1: a viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant.
def2: a country in South America that occupies a long coastal strip that runs down the western side of Bolivia and Argentina, on the Pacific Ocean; population 18,000,000 (estimated 2015); capital, Santiago; official language, Spanish.

def1: a morpheme, not necessarily surviving as a word in itself, from which words have been made by the addition of prefixes or suffixes or by other modification.
def2: sarcastic.

def1: the perceptible natural movement of the air, especially in the form of a current of air blowing from a particular direction.
def2: (of wind) move creating an air current.

def1: trash, such as paper, cans, and bottles, that is left lying in an open or public place.
def2: discarded matter; refuse.

def1: an outstandingly good person or thing.
def2: four-dimensional.

def1: a shoe for a horse formed of a narrow band of iron in the form of an extended circular arc and secured to the hoof with nails.
def2: a solid material that is typically hard, shiny, malleable, fusible, and ductile, with good electrical and thermal conductivity (e.g., iron, gold, silver, copper, and aluminum, and alloys such as brass and steel).

def1: a strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, used for flogging or beating a person or for urging on an animal.
def2: physical suffering or discomfort caused by illness or injury.

def1: Lauren Nicole London is an American actress. Beginning her career in music videos and later moving into film and television acting, London earned recognition and rose to fame for her performance as Erin "New New" Garnett in the 2006 coming-of-age film ATL. She appeared in the 2007 American Christmas film This Christmas, as well as the television shows 90210 and Entourage, and as Kiera Whitaker on the BET comedy-drama, The Game. London was a spokesmodel for Sean Combs's Sean John collection in 2007.
def2: an act of stopping or interrupting the supply or provision of something.

def1: a unit of weight in general use equal to 16 oz. avoirdupois (0.4536 kg).
def2: a body's relative mass or the quantity of matter contained by it, giving rise to a downward force; the heaviness of a person or thing.

def1: a container filled with explosive, incendiary material, smoke, gas, or other destructive substance, designed to explode on impact or when detonated by a time mechanism, remote-control device, or lit fuse.
def2: a large, heavy piece of artillery, typically mounted on wheels, formerly used in warfare.

def1: a small circular band, typically of precious metal and often set with one or more gemstones, worn on a finger as an ornament or a token of marriage, engagement, or authority.
def2: each of the four slender jointed parts attached to either hand (or five, if the thumb is included).

def1: the students and staff of a school.
def2: Madeleine Madden is an Australian actress. She is best known for playing Egwene al'Vere in the Amazon Prime series The Wheel of Time.

def1: a vessel larger than a boat for transporting people or goods by sea.
def2: Free were an English rock band formed in London in 1968, best known for their hit songs "All Right Now" and "Wishing Well". They disbanded in 1973; lead singer Paul Rodgers went on to become the frontman of the more successful rock supergroup Bad Company, which also featured his Free bandmate Simon Kirke on drums. Lead guitarist Paul Kossoff formed Back Street Crawler in 1973, but died from a pulmonary embolism at the age of 25 in 1976. Bassist Andy Fraser formed Sharks.

def1: a strong, hard magnetic silvery-gray metal, the chemical element of atomic number 26, much used as a material for construction and manufacturing, especially in the form of steel.
def2: a red-brown metal, the chemical element of atomic number 29.

def1: smooth (clothes, sheets, etc.) with an iron.
def2: a green aphid which is a common pest of crops and garden plants.

def1: 1st Baron Snow of Leicester (1905–80), English novelist and scientist; full name Charles Percy Snow. He is best known for his sequence of 11 novels, starting with Strangers and Brothers (1940), that deals with moral dilemmas in the academic world and for his lecture Two Cultures (1959).
def2: change from one condition, form, or state to another.

def1: a person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences.
def2: be the first to find or observe (a place, substance, or scientific phenomenon).

def1: a hard creamy-white substance composing the main part of the tusks of an elephant, walrus, or narwhal, often (especially formerly) used to make ornaments and other articles.
def2: a heavy plant-eating mammal with a prehensile trunk, long curved ivory tusks, and large ears, native to Africa and southern Asia. It is the largest living land animal.

def1: a cephalopod mollusc with eight sucker-bearing arms, a soft body, strong beaklike jaws, and no internal shell.
def2: of or connected with the eyes or vision.

def1: an official letter sent from the representative of one government to another.
def2: appear in a certain way; be suggestive of something.

def1: a building for the performance of opera.
def2: an advocate of women's rights on the basis of the equality of the sexes; a person who supports feminism.

def1: a continuous flow of data or instructions, typically one having a constant or predictable rate.
def2: Netflix, Inc. is an American subscription streaming service and production company based in Los Gatos, California. Founded in 1997 by Reed Hastings and Marc Randolph in Scotts Valley, California, it offers a film and television series library through distribution deals as well as its own productions, known as Netflix Originals.

def1: something in the shape of a circle.
def2: Charlyne Amanda Yi is an American actor, comedian, musician, and writer. Their performances include music, magic, games, and often audience participation.

def1: a dramatic work in one or more acts, set to music for singers and instrumentalists.
def2: make musical sounds with the voice, especially words with a set tune.

def1: a large rounded orange-yellow fruit with a thick rind, edible flesh, and many seeds.
def2: A shoe is an item of footwear intended to protect and comfort the human foot. They are often worn with a sock. Shoes are also used as an item of decoration and fashion. The design of shoes has varied enormously through time and from culture to culture, with form originally being tied to function. Though the human foot can adapt to varied terrains and climate conditions, it is still vulnerable to environmental hazards such as sharp rocks and temperature extremes, which shoes protect against. Some shoes are worn as safety equipment, such as steel-toe boots which are required footwear at industrial worksites.

def1: a weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood whose ends are joined by a taut string.
def2: material consisting of threads of cotton, hemp, or other material twisted together to form a thin length.

def1: a precious stone consisting of a clear and colorless crystalline form of pure carbon, the hardest naturally occurring substance.
def2: (of nuclear material) able to become fissile by the capture of neutrons.

def1: a dollar.
def2: the basic monetary unit of the US, Canada, Australia, and certain countries in the Pacific, Caribbean, Southeast Asia, Africa, and South America.

def1: a public room or building where gambling games are played.
def2: play games of chance for money; bet.

def1: (of a sum of money) be enough to pay (a bill or cost).
def2: give (someone) money that is due for work done, goods received, or a debt incurred.

def1: Australia is a 2008 epic adventure drama film directed by Baz Luhrmann and starring Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. The screenplay was written by Luhrmann and screenwriter Stuart Beattie, with Ronald Harwood and Richard Flanagan. The film is a character story, set between 1939 and 1942 against a dramatised backdrop of events across northern Australia at the time, such as the bombing of Darwin during World War II.
def2: (in drama) a closing speech addressed to the audience.

def1: a continent in the northern hemisphere, separated from Africa on the south by the Mediterranean Sea and from Asia on the east roughly by the Bosporus, the Caucasus Mountains, and the Ural Mountains. Europe contains approximately 10 percent of the world's population. It consists of the western part of the landmass of which Asia forms the eastern (and greater) part and includes the British Isles, Iceland, and most of the Mediterranean islands. Its recent history has been dominated by the decline of European states from their former colonial and economic preeminence, the emergence of the European Union among the wealthy democracies of western Europe, and the collapse of the Soviet Union with consequent changes of power in central and eastern Europe.
def2: the largest of the world's continents, constituting nearly one third of the land mass, lying entirely north of the equator except for some Southeast Asian islands. It is connected to Africa by the Isthmus of Suez, and borders Europe (part of the same land mass) along the Ural Mountains and across the Caspian Sea.

def1: the sixth planet from the sun in the solar system, circled by a system of broad flat rings.
def2: the largest planet in the solar system, a gas giant which is the fifth in order from the sun and one of the brightest objects in the night sky.

def1: a vast mountain system in southern Asia that extends for 1,500 miles (2,400 km) from Kashmir east to Assam. The Himalayas consist of a series of parallel ranges that rise up from the Ganges River basin to the Tibetan plateau. The backbone is the Great Himalayan Range, the highest mountain range in the world, with several peaks rising to over 25,000 feet (7,700 m), the highest being Mount Everest.
def2: Anorexia nervosa, often referred to simply as anorexia, is an eating disorder characterized by low weight, food restriction, body image disturbance, fear of gaining weight, and an overpowering desire to be thin. Anorexia is a term of Greek origin: an- and orexis, translating literally to "a loss of appetite"; the adjective nervosa indicating the functional and non-organic nature of the disorder. Anorexia nervosa was coined by Gull in 1873 but, despite literal translation, the symptom of hunger is frequently present and the pathological control of this instinct is a source of satisfaction for the patients.

def1: (1858–1928), US army officer and engineer. As chief engineer and chairman of the Panama Canal Commission 1907, he oversaw construction of the Panama Canal, which was completed in 1914, and then served as the Canal Zone's governor 1914–17.
def2: try to save as much money as possible; economize.

def1: deceive or fool (someone).
def2: (of a person) not able to be contacted by phone or other means.

def1: mark (an item) with a tick or select (a box) on a form, questionnaire, etc., to indicate that something has been chosen, checked, approved, or dealt with.
def2: having ten parts or elements.

def1: money returned to someone as the balance of the amount paid for something.
def2: a light medium-dry white wine produced in the valley of the Mosel River.

def1: roughness given to a surface to allow color or glue to adhere.
def2: the forward part of a ship's hull below the waterline, considered in terms of breadth or narrowness.

def1: a substance that brings about a chemical or physical effect or causes a chemical reaction.
def2: (of a negative feeling or a problem) become worse or more intense, especially through long-term neglect or indifference.

def1: an adult male horse; a stallion or gelding.
def2: a secondary jet or propeller on a ship or offshore rig, used for accurate maneuvering and maintenance of position.

def1: an outdoor overgarment, typically sleeveless, that hangs loosely from the shoulders.
def2: have on one's body or a part of one's body as clothing, decoration, protection, or for some other purpose.

def1: an optical instrument designed to make distant objects appear nearer, containing an arrangement of lenses, or of curved mirrors and lenses, by which rays of light are collected and focused and the resulting image magnified.
def2: perceive with the eyes; discern visually.

def1: material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances, used for writing, drawing, or printing on, or as wrapping material.
def2: a woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.

def1: a brass instrument like a small trumpet, typically without valves or keys and used for military signals.
def2: Carmen Sandiego is an animated action-adventure television series with educational elements, based on the media franchise of the same name created by Broderbund. The series is produced by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt with WildBrain serving as the production company, and contains a "serialized look at Carmen's backstory that is told from her perspective". Serving as an origin story for the fictional thieving villain of the same name, it is the fourth Carmen Sandiego television show after the PBS game shows Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? and Where in Time is Carmen Sandiego?, and the Fox animated series Where on Earth is Carmen Sandiego?; it is also the first Carmen Sandiego related show since the end of Where on Earth is Carmen Sandiego in 1999.

def1: an association of European states founded in 1949 to safeguard the political and cultural heritage of Europe and promote economic and social cooperation. One of the Council's principal achievements is the European Convention on Human Rights.
def2: Vairamuthu Ramasamy is an Indian lyricist, poet, and novelist working in the Tamil film industry. He is a prominent figure in the Tamil literary world. A master's graduate from the Pachaiyappa's College in Chennai, he first worked as a translator, while also being a published poet. He entered the Tamil film industry in the year 1980, with the film Nizhalgal, an Ilaiyaraaja musical, directed by Bharathiraja. During the course of his 40-year film career, he has written over 7,500 songs and poems which have won him seven National Awards, the most for any Indian lyricist. He has also been honored with a Padma Shri, a Padma Bhushan and a Sahitya Akademi Award, for his abundant literary output.

def1: an aircraft powered by one or more jet engines.
def2: an upright water or gas pipe.

def1: an offer of something enticing as a means of persuasion (often contrasted with the threat of something punitive or unwelcome).
def2: a place from which goods are sold or distributed.

def1: (of interest) payable on both capital and the accumulated interest.
def2: money paid regularly at a particular rate for the use of money lent, or for delaying the repayment of a debt.

def1: an island country and continent in the southern hemisphere, in the southwestern Pacific Ocean, a member state of the Commonwealth of Nations; population 28,500,000 (estimated 2015); capital, Canberra; official language, English. Inhabited by Aboriginal peoples since prehistoric times, Australia was explored by the Dutch from 1606; British colonization began in 1788, as did the transportation of convicts from Britain, a practice that was discontinued in 1868. Australia was declared a commonwealth in 1901 when the six colonies (New South Wales, Victoria, Queensland, South Australia, Western Australia, and Tasmania) federated as sovereign states. The two mainland federal territories, the Northern Territory and the Australian Capital Territory, became self-governing in 1978 and 1989, respectively. Although an independent nation, Australia is a constitutional monarchy whose formal head of state is Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom.
def2: a failure to function in a normal or satisfactory manner.
